<!-- {{< include templates/_event_description.qmd >}} -->

<p>The OSC offers a workshop on data privacy and anonymity for participants ranging from graduate students to professors. The workhop will be held by Felix Schönbrodt and Anton Marx.</p><p>Contents:</p><ul>
<li>Why should we share data?</li>
<li>Which kinds of research data need to be protected? What are personal data?</li>
<li>How can the risk of re-identification be assessed?</li>
<li>How can data be anonymized?</li>
<li>A short discussion about new technological solutions that allow sharing sensible data (e.g. synthetical data, scientific use files, differential privacy)</li>
<li>What are easy steps to enhance procedural safety in the use of sensible data?</li>
</ul>
<div>The workshop contains of both theoretical input and hands-on exercises. Please bring your own laptop (preferably with R and RStudio installed). Skills in R will be beneficial but not essential.</div><div></div><div><em>Notice: End of march or beginning of April, there will be another OSC workshop on "Advanced Power Analysis". Announcement will be made seperately on the OSC news website.</em></div><div class="g-clear"></div>
